alert.note: Alert for Martin; Pike (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 25 at 8:40AM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of central Martin and Pike Counties through 915 AM EDT... At 840 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Calf Creek to Chattaroy to 9 miles west of War. Movement was south at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Mcandrews, McClure, Phelps and Board Tree around 855 AM EDT. Laura, Moree, Kimper and Coleman around 900 AM EDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include Threeforks, Heenan, Piso, Jarad, Phyllis, Biggs, Varney, Fishtrap Lake, Fedscreek, Pikeville, Coal Run Village, Elkhorn City, Meta, Mouthcard, Belcher, Cedarville, Toonerville, Zebulon and Marrowbone. THIS INCLUDES THE FOLLOWING HIGHWAYS... U.S. Highway 119 in Pike County between mile markers 1 and 24. U.S. Highway 23 in Pike County between mile markers 6 and 27. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
